name: pandan
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a tropical tree whose leaves are used in cooking to give a flavour similar to vanilla (= a sweet spice), and can also be used to make floor coverings, rope, etc.: Pandan grows in tropical areas of Asia. Cook your rice with pandan then use it to stuff roast chicken. The fish came rolled in a pandan leaf.
Ivan Mentawai/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe aromatic pandan grows abundantly in the Philippines. Pandans or screw pines are not closely related to palm trees.Common ingredients in Penang cooking include pungent roots like galangal and turmeric and aromatic leaves like pandan. The custard was fragrantly flavored with pandan.The menu includes a few Thai dishes, such as pandan chicken.The weavers produce basic pandan mats or roll the leaves into pandan ropes.
